website_summaries.verdict: A small set, but it's a smart collection with tools you'll often need for home repairs.
pros: Orange colored handles make it easy to spot stray tools
Excellent price point for a first tool box
Decent quality of the tools, considering the low cost
All tools fit comfortably and tightly in the small box
cons: Very basic tool box with minimal number of tools
Longevity of a few tools is questionable

customer_reviews.title: missing one vital part
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kit because it was inexpensive, small, but still had the typical tools you might need in a pinch. Only thing I didn't notice until I needed it was there are no philips head screw driver bits! There are regular, start tips, and allen tipped bits, but there is also and allen wrench set that comes with it, so I think the allen screwdriver heads is a little redundant, especially at the cost of phillips head bits. other than that its been handy.
customer_reviews.author: BTSM

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my Grand daughter in her first apartment ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Grand daughter in her first apartment. Did every job she had, whether hanging pictures or repairing fireplace screen or installing light plates. Everything necessary is there.
customer_reviews.author: J. allen

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a gift for my guy, who ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my guy, who is very particular (I half figured I would probably have to send it back). However, he loves it and says he more than impressed with the quality and versatality of the tools.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a nice selection of tools with good quality. It's easily portable and the case doesn't come undone. I recommend this product for anyone looking their first household tools, portability, quality, and/or low pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Good starter set
customer_reviews.text: Great starter tool set. The tools have really come in handy since I moved into my new apartment. I expected there to be an adjustable wrench, but that's my fault for not reading all the details. I underestimated the quality of the products, specifically the box cutter... It was really sharp, so be careful! I'm giving it a 4 because the products don't stay in there designated slots. When the container is closed, items will fall out. Not the end of the world, just kind of annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my sister in her first apartment. She needed a measuring tape but the price on this starter kit was excellent so she got a whole set. Perfect for anyone starting out or who needs a basic set.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: The build quality isn't perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is what it is. A cheaply made toolset for around the house or car that will work in a pinch or is handy to have around. If you'll notice, there are actually two other toolsets identical to this model, one with red accent colors on the case and tools, and one with green. They are all the same, and just branded by separate companies. I purchased this to perpetually stay in the trunk of my car for emergency or random usage.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Groux

customer_reviews.title: perfect set for the light DIY-er
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a while ago and have seldom used it. However, I recently decided I wanted to fix a lamp and needed the screwdriver from this kit. I was scouring the house looking for the pretty pink tools and my boyfriend refused to help because "I don't know how to use anything in it." (dude, its a hammer and a screwdriver, thats rude.) Found the kit, fixed the lamp, then used the screwdriver to unscrew some cabinets and door hinges and went to my tool master boyfriend to let him fix it all because "I don't know how to use anything in it". Not comparing this to craftsman or anything, but It works for a novice!
customer_reviews.author: KaitKat22

customer_reviews.title: Contains lead...
customer_reviews.text: I truthfully did not open this tool set, so I cannot speak to the quality of the tools or the box. The label on the top of the tool kit advises wearing gloves and contains the warning "This product can expose you to chemicals including lead, which is known to the State of California to cause cancer or reproductive harm." Perhaps this was to be expected for a product manufactured in China, but I did not see this warning anywhere in the product information before ordering. It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: HPG

customer_reviews.title: The perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect gift for what we wanted. We gave it as a graduation gift. We had given our daughter one when she went to school, and it worked out so well, we repeated the gift. Our daughter hid hers under her bed for some time, until people kept asking if any one had a hammer, From that point on, she was the go to person. She still has it and still uses it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Yeah, it’s an inexpensive starter tool set but it should at least be sturdy enough to be functional. Arrived with a loose latch on one side that falls off every time the case is opened and slides back on in a loose position. Can’t really securely close the case without fearing the latch will fall back off *update: day 2 of ownership. Both latches fell off and can’t be put back on because the plastic cracked. box can’t be latched. No contact from seller regarding the first review of receiving the product broken. Pay a little more and get a different tool box
customer_reviews.author: Moonsamiches

customer_reviews.title: Received used and damaged tools
customer_reviews.text: When I received this item it had clearly been used and returned. Tools weren’t locked into their designated spots, some of the screw driver heads weren’t in their slots, there was a head placed on the screwdriver, plastic part of scissors was broken, tools were dusty and so was the outside of the container. I returned the tools and bought a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: I liked the size and amount of tools that were included
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an emergency kit for my car, in case I ever came across something where I needed a tool. I liked the size and amount of tools that were included. It also matches my car. Great little as needed kit, for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory And Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend to anyone interested
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product for my Mom. She absolutely loves it. It has everything she could possibly need and its organized in a way not to take up to much space. Would definitely recommend to anyone interested.
customer_reviews.author: Gale M.

customer_reviews.title: Handy...
customer_reviews.text: The tools are entirely serviceable, but as I purchased this as a small set of tools to throw into my filing cabinet at work, the best part is the variety of tools they throw into a very small case. I haven't damaged any of them, but they don't feel as durable as a quality set of shop or automotive tools -- but that wasn't what I was looking for. Seems to be just the ticket for work to tighten the odd screw, install small items or tap offending gizmos back into place rather than having to wait for building maintenance or IT to show up. A good deal...
customer_reviews.author: Geriatric Suthriner

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great starter or travel set!
customer_reviews.text: Great little starter set at a great price. I bought this for my daughter to have in her first apartment. It has all the basics, plus a few extra screwdriver bits that go beyond basic. The hammer, pliers and tape measure are smaller than full size, but they do the trick! This would also be a good travel set to keep in your car. The only negative is when opening the case, the orange release tabs don’t slide easily.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Apples

customer_reviews.title: Magnets Jammed into the Screwdriver???
customer_reviews.text: I'll be straightforward and say that I was too lazy to return this. I've kept it, tried to correct the problem myself (maybe 50% succeeded) and the entire rest of the set has been very useful and solidly reliable. But when the set arrived, the replaceable screwdriver tip had four or five circular magnets jammed inside?? I literally can't even imagine how this could have happened. I was able to remove two of them, and can basically use it now but it's awkward and the replaceable tips tilt a little. Really sucks i don't have a perfect screwdriver but again, the rest of the set is great so 3 stars...
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Not a handyman?
customer_reviews.text: There's a difference between someone who makes a living as a handyman and someone who just wants the right tool on hand if something requires it (like ordering something from Amazon with "some assembly" required and you find yourself needing an Allen wrench). This kit has pretty much anything you'd ever need for home use. The pieces feel solid and the variety is impressive. If you actually ARE a handyman you're probably going to want a heavier hammer, a power drill with a lot of bits, perhaps a skill saw ... as stated above, this is for the average citizen for home use. It's an excellent set, well priced, for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: TGoodwin

customer_reviews.title: Great student gift or set of tools to keep in vehicle
customer_reviews.text: Good little set of tools to use just in case. Would be a great set to have in your vehicle or to purchase as a gift for a college student moving into an apartment/dorm. I bought this as a gift for my teenage son. He was always taking his dads tools for little projects and then forgetting to put them back where they belong. I figured if I got him his own set of tools with a case having a distinct space for everything, he would do a better job keeping things together. Plus, it's a nice set to take with him when he moves out one day. He was happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mama V

customer_reviews.title: Durable tool set
customer_reviews.text: Good household tool set. I've used this tool set to assemble and fix many items. Very durable. The container it comes in fits in small spaces and is easy to store. I would recommend it for a small household tool set.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Thompson

customer_reviews.title: A Good Starter Kit of Tools
customer_reviews.text: Received zero compensation for this review. I'd rate this 3 1/2 stars if it was possible. Good starter kit, includes most tools everyone needs at one time or another. Appropriate for anyone moving away from home for the first time. There will be a day when one of these tools will be needed and whoever needs it will be thankful to have it on hand. Tools are average quality. They all fit in a small, compact, light, and sturdy case.
customer_reviews.author: sifr

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy duty use. Very basic toolkit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool box thinking that it would consist of every tool but this has disappointed me on that. The tools provided are not strong enough for heavy duty usage. Screwdriver does not have all the attachment which are actually required for fixing things. I had to buy a separate set of tool kit apart from this to fulfill my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mamta

customer_reviews.title: Only get this if you can't afford ANY OTHER SET of tools. Fragile and cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Literally the first time I opened it, two things broke. The latch snapped off and one of the screwdrivers shredded itself when I closed it. It's an extremely cheap set, horrible quality, and don't expect the case to be worth keeping either, but the hammer seems solid, and it doesn't seem worth the hassle of sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything I Need
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teacher, and I wanted a small tool kit for basic jobs in my classroom. Without taking up much space, this little beauty gives me a hammer, tape measure, a utility knife, a wide variety of Allen keys and screwdrivers, and more. I threw a small handful of screws and nails into the bottom of the case, and it does everything I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: cmosier

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality, very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Best tool set for the price. I find myself using it often. Not the best quality out there but it'll do whatever odd job you need it to do. The box cutter is trash though-it's unstable and wiggles. The hammer isn't good at removing staples because the edges are too broad and thick to slip under. The bigger screwdriver with multiple tips isn't the best either-the tips wiggle just the slightest bit and the handle isn't as ergonomic as others. Have not used the other tools. But unless you expect to do multiple home projects and/or want a ride-or-die A+++ tool set, this will serve you well and get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to have as a "just need a screwdriver real quick" set. The case is really nice - everything is kept in its place very well, and it's all organized and easy to see. I love that it's Pink so I can tell mine from my dad's. Also, easy to find, to be honest. I've set down black and yellow tools and been unable to find them a moment later. I only wish this set had a level. Just a little 6" version would work. I don't need it often, but it does happen.
customer_reviews.author: C. Posley

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: VERY happy with this set! I went through a break up and couldn't sort through his tools to find all of mine, just easier to grab this little tool box! The pink is a nice bonus, obviously doesn't affect the quality. My only complaint after using nearly all the pieces is that the allen wrench set doesn't stay put in its little compartment. Every time I open the box, they come loose. Overall, totally worth it for the price and convenience.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Not as Great as Hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: At first this tool set looked really great. I started to notice that the locks on the outside are super flimsy and are not going to last very long. And then I went to the inside. The mini screw driver's were very poorly made. The ends caps were barley even connected. I had to glue them on. Tons of things were loose on certain tools. Lots of the tools are cheeply made but for the price and quantity. That is unfortunately to be expected. I am still going to use the tool set even though it is not made as well as it should have been.
customer_reviews.author: Valued Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and useful
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a tool kit to bring to college for easy access to tools while dorming. This took kit fit my every need. It has plenty of screw head options to connect to the handle and can even attach to a drill bit. It has all the basic necessities of a tool kit and is easy to store just about anywhere. My one complaint would be the strong smell of the rubber. It's not the most pleasant thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kaila

customer_reviews.title: Really good staeter set of tools
customer_reviews.text: Not the most heavy duty and if you work w tools every day spend your money on quality stuff. This gets the job done around the house for most needs. The bigger stuff works better the little screwdrivers are a bit flimsy and lean towards bending if a screw is too tight. I have completely given up on the tape measure which only measures about 3ft which is surprisingly never enough length and it also refuses to extend properly anyway. Those are my only complaints and it does do most small stuff around the house so if you just find yourself needing a hammer or pair of pliers on a very infrequent occasion this is actually a pretty good set.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: A Good Basic Tool Set For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son when he moved away to college. It came in handy for small repairs, handing pictures and for assembling furniture. It has most of the basic stuff you will need. I wish they would have dropped the scissors and included 2 pairs of pliers (1 standard and 1 needle nose) instead of 1 combo pliers that doesn't fit well in small spaces. Also would prefer a ratchet style screw driver handle to the standard one that was included here. Otherwise, it's a descent basic tool set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can she fix it? Yes she CAN!!!
customer_reviews.text: **The pronoun she is used in the title because that is how I identify. This product nor my review is geared toward gender specifically. I purchased this to have on hand in a pinch and for minor household uses like hanging pictures, etc. I believe that is what it is designed to accommodate. I do not believe this is a good choice if you are going to have ongoing projects or daily use. While the quality is very good, some of the pieces will not hold up for daily use. I posted a video review.
customer_reviews.author: JLadii

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy unless you want rigged results
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap made product. The measuring tape won’t go back into the tube. The toolbox doesn’t close all the way. I bought this for small home projects but it’s causing more problems than solving.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Everybody wanted it!
customer_reviews.text: For our department holiday party at work, this is what I purchased as my gift. Our department is mostly women, with several "handy, do it yourselfer-types". This was the gift that resulted in the stealing and hair-pulling catfights. This tool set dissolved long term friendships. It ended with the 3rd person to get it, working out a "trade deal" so another woman could get it back afterwards. I have to say that I honesty don't know about the quality of the actual tools, but this is definitely a nice assortment of tools for "quickie little repairs" or to keep as a backup kit... and its PINK, so you know they are HER tools!
customer_reviews.author: Serenity

customer_reviews.title: They're okay
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several of these for our son and a couple of his friends. They're all under 6-8 years old. The exacto knife was removed by the parents since they're sharp. Decent starter tool set. They love using the hammer and measuring tape and tightening screws. It's nice and portable. My son much prefers regular screwdrivers to these though; they're not very well made. It's the biggest drawback, but for a beginner toolbox, it's ok. Screwdrivers are not very durable and broke easily.
customer_reviews.author: fringe fx

customer_reviews.title: Might consider paying more for better quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good kit because it includesmost of what you need for simple home repairs, but it is definitely the cheap version of it. The box is kinda hard to open, and feels really cheap. The tools are supposed to fit snug into a spot, but i can't get them to stay in the spot - so they all spill out when I open the box. Finally, the tape measure won't fully retract after using it...i have to manually push it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you need to equip yourself with a few basic tools, this is a good set for the price. So far, the tools have held up under occasional use and feel reasonably sturdy. The mini screwdrivers feel a little flimsy but they've been okay. The case is handy for storage, although I was tired of trying to manipulate all the tools back into their proper places so I ended up putting the tools in a tool bag. Regardless, though, if you need some decent, yet inexpensive tools, this set fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa R. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: So Happy I Found This Set!
customer_reviews.text: I am not the typical "handy woman", however, I purchased some new furniture items and my random dollar store tools were not cutting it! lol. This set comes with EVERYTHING you may need when putting things together! I love the variety!!!! And I love that the set comes in a variety of colors! I purchased the pink set. Since purchasing this set, I have been so eager (and confident) to fix things around my apartment! I truly recommend this set for beginners and advance handy people.
customer_reviews.author: Christinah Olaniyi

customer_reviews.title: Great tool set
customer_reviews.text: Just received this yesterday. It arrived on time, in perfect condition, and is exactly as described. I have no complaints at all. I'm really glad I got a tool set instead of what I was originally going to do, just get a hammer, lol. I actually used a few pieces as soon as I got it around the house, they did well. This set is nice, and I should be good to go now, and the case locks well. I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: T. Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Don’t think, just buy! Never ask your man for a tool again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I wouldn’t have to ask my boyfriend for another tool again and I’m so happy I did! Great value for money and comes with everything you’d need. I like it because it comes with the perfect essential tools and doesn’t come with anything I don’t need- that’s where my boyfriends tools come in. It also comes in a nice little case that makes it easy to transport. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shell Krenzler

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for a week, used it multiple times already. Strong sturdy tools for a really great price! So far I've used them to take off vent covers for the central air so I could clean them, tightened bolts on my desk chair, tightened my tree lamps bolts and screws, fixed a pipe and cut down alot of boxes to recycle. Not having any issues like I did with the last tool box I had which cost me more money.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki Mann

customer_reviews.title: All the basics
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few weeks ago because tools seem to be going missing. I wanted something that came with a case that was easy to keep organized. The tool set comes with all the basics outside of a power drill. I really liked that it came in pink. Now there is no doubt that these are MINE 😊
customer_reviews.author: LexiLikesLiterature

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retired widow living with an adult child and grandchildren so I am limited on space. I don't feel comfortable getting into the SIL's tool box for tools so this was the perfect solution. This tool set (which I used within an hour after it arrived) is the perfect size, has a good selection of tools, and even matches my color scheme! The quality could be better...that would have been a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: WiQ

customer_reviews.title: Will strongly recommend not to buy this, cheap quality tools
customer_reviews.text: About the product: I have received all the pieces mentioned. Screw driver as said it's not magnetic. Auto winding if tape does not happen at times, we have to manually push it inside. Small screw drivers are plastic and they tend to break with small force. Pros: a single tool box with all the tools at one place for all household purposes. Cons: quality of all the tools inside the box are bad
customer_reviews.author: Bharani Kothareddy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great little toolkit! I manage apartments and bought it for every single apartment for the residents. The tools are all good quality and super compact. Everything is easy to use. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Snow Rose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my classroom
customer_reviews.text: I'm a high school teacher and am always needing to tighten a screw, pound in a nail, hang a hook, etc. I got tired of bringing tools from home so I bought this small kit so I'd always have something on hand when I needed it. This kit fits the bill perfectly as it has a variety of common tools in a compact case. It's not super-high quality, but for the purpose it's exactly what I needed. I would have spent more money buying three or four individual tools separately.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Decent Household Toolkit
customer_reviews.text: The Tool Set is serviceable for most small and daily uses. I'd question it's quality at a higher level as the pliers that I were using felt pretty shaky when I was using them for more "heavy duty" constructions and I needed something pulled out. However, the hammer and the screw drivers as well as the Allen wrenches were great with multiple sizes and shapes for most jobs. I've used this in various places and I keep it in the back of my car for small immediate construction uses. If you're looking for something with heavy duty quality look elsewhere; otherwise, this is a good household item to keep around as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Eru

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Toolkit. Perfect for Small Jobs
customer_reviews.text: I had the Pink Toolkit First~I Bought the Kit to Keep in Kitchen Draw Conveniently in Case I Needed a Small Fix Around the Kitchen. My Husband Poked Fun of My Little Toolkit Every-time I Used it. Came to Find he Borrowed My Pink Kit Whenever a Screwdriver or Hammer Was Needed for His Small Repairs....This is Why I Bought the Blue Toolkit 4 Him. LOL...Great Gift 👍🏽
customer_reviews.author: Echism

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had more pieces
customer_reviews.text: I do like that it comes with so many pieces and it has been very helpful, but since, this is the only toolbox I have i might need to upgrade it. Recently, we bought a bike and needed to assemble, and this cartman came short with several items. Had to search around to find other tools to complement this one. Overall, it is a good starter toolkit.
customer_reviews.author: Malik Moonzajer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this can be offered at such a low price? I was looking to buy a measuring tape. I came across this tool set for.....3 bucks more! Granted it's not heirloom quality and the tape measure is only 10 feet but who cares? Everything works and looks exactly as pictured. I'm so impressed I'm buying another one as a gift for my nephew and tucking a few bucks inside. So much better than just giving money and the cost isn't much more that a gift card holder!
customer_reviews.author: ManchVegas

customer_reviews.title: Bargain, Rough Case
customer_reviews.text: The tools feel fine and it's a great bargain for it's price, but the quality doesn't feel like it's on a nice enough level for this to be giftable. I mostly choose it because there's lots of orange and I'm about to move into my first apartment, I wanted something compact and with a decent variety. On that end it performs well. The case in particular is where it feels cheapest but that's just a holder so it's not super significant.
customer_reviews.author: Taldak

customer_reviews.title: Practical for the price
customer_reviews.text: The tools are sized for a woman so don't expect standard size. They come in a cute compact box. If you're expecting the tools to look high quality, then you will get disappointed because they look cheap but they work well. Overall I like the tool box, it matches the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Grisel

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for her
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife as a replacement for a set we got the second year we were married. This has been a hard to find combination. With a compact case, she has the handiest collection to grab for a quick little project, and it keeps her out of the garage where she might be tempted to think I could use a little help in my organizational skills.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: A good set for a woman!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tool set was exactly as advertised and i am so glad i bought it! I thought that i would not be able to use it since i am clueless when it comes to tools, but now feel like i ready for any challenge! so happy with this purchase! Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: LInda White

customer_reviews.title: Great Handy Toolkit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on lightning deal for someone who could use a few tools. The kit arrived a bit dented but the tools inside were fine. It has pretty much everything you would need to tackle small projects around the house. Ive already used it for setting up a TV and stand. Please note it is on the smaller size but filled with all sorts of tools. If you love alone and not too handy but needs a few tools for small jobs, this may be the best investment.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned this set for 2 weeks so I cannot attest to the overall sturdiness nor durability. I can say I like the various sizes of screwdrivers as well as the overall assortment of the most commonly used tools in the average household. For the price, I have no real objections. Will provide an update on overall thoughts in a few months
customer_reviews.author: Kindle guru

customer_reviews.title: Good product - good delivery
customer_reviews.text: Here we have a great addition to any workshop or hobby work space. I put my tool set to work the second it arrived a few days ago. As I'm building another model railroad, (O gauge Lionel,) I found the small set of screw drivers of particular interest when assembling Fast Track. And of course the pliers, tape measure, hammer and so on were also of particular value. In short, a great set at a great price. Many thanks,
customer_reviews.author: Hal Owen

customer_reviews.title: I'd keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for doing small bits around my apartment. Have realized since purchasing it's missing some key basic tools (i.e. A WRENCH! I've needed one multiple times). I've also found that none of the tools stay in their slots so every time I open this up everything goes flying. The tools that are included all work well, and it's nice and compact but I'd search for another option that contains a few more basics.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I like this set because it’s pink and doesn’t cost a fortune. But I have to be honest. You definitely get what you paid for. The plastic is a cheap molded plastic. It isn’t sturdy at all. The hinges on the case are cheap and the tools roughly the same. I haven’t broken anything so far, but I haven’t really put it to good use for fear of breaking it. Definitely could be better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool set
customer_reviews.text: We were moving and needed a simple tool kit to keep in between houses to do simple tasks, this tool set did the job perfectly. It seems like it was well thought out including the scissors, box cutter (though a little flimsy), and tape measure - for a new home that you're not quite ready to move into, these were much needed items! It's a very basic set and can help with basic home maintenance/break-fix items. Note: I purchased this item and did NOT receive a discount for my review.
customer_reviews.author: Black Sheep

customer_reviews.title: Love this set!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set for someone who has mild repairs they need to do. I keep it in my office at work and our maintenance crew isn’t always available so, this set came extremely handy for me. Only issue I have is the Allen wrenches don’t want to snap into the base all the way but if I close it just right, I don’t have any issues of them falling out.
customer_reviews.author: NSN21

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs a toolbox
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why it took me so long to buy one of these. Everyone needs a toolbox. When I moved, I had to "build" most of my furniture & I did not have the tools I needed. I felt very foolish for not ordering one before I moved & for thinking that I wouldn't need one b/c I'm a woman. I don't care for the color, I prefer all black but they work for their intended purpose, plus it was really affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Desha Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set
customer_reviews.text: I am moving into a new place and needed a tool set. I purchased this one as my very first tool set, and I love it! It has everything that I need to get jobs done around the house. I had an issue with the scissors that came in the set not cutting properly, so I reached out to the company and they are sending me a replacement set no questions asked. I am super impressed with the customer service and how quickly they resolved my tiny issue. I highly recommend this as a starter tool set, you won't be disappointed. And if for some reason you have any issues the company will handle it promptly :)
customer_reviews.author: Erika J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Basics Toolkit
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retired, single woman, and needed a replacement basic toolkit, as I gave my former one to my daughter. The big box Home "Improvement" store didn't have one, so I found this on Amazon; based on reviews, i bought the Cartman, and it doesn't disappoint! Better than my previous one! Love this and the price!
customer_reviews.author: GaMom

customer_reviews.title: versatility
customer_reviews.text: This is a birthday gift for a granddaughter so can't give a full report, but she was thrilled with it and inspected all the various items.
customer_reviews.author: jenna

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I could assemble my IKEA desk..........this set was amazing, especially the different sizes for the screwdriver function (Flathead and non). This set is so amazing for the low price; I've since used this to disassemble and assemble several household items. A great kit for any household!
customer_reviews.author: BgCutie

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive tools for basic home maintenance
customer_reviews.text: If I were a master mechanic buying the top of the line tools, this would be a very low rating. But I'm not. I just needed a tool kit to leave in my step-daughter's apartment with the basics. Given the low price, this tool set is everything we need for basic maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: GDogg

customer_reviews.title: Pink works for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a way to distinguish my tools from my husband (who has a habit of borrowing stuff and not remembering where he put it...which is NEVER where he got it from.) At least with pink he'll know it's girly and think twice. And when I see it out of place, I'll know immediately. :o)
customer_reviews.author: JuEwelry

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife because she complains about not being able to find the right tool for her crafts and I don't want her using mine because she never puts them back. Then she saw this an made a comment about wanting something like it. For what it is it is perfect for her and with the case everything has its own place to go. She actually puts the tools back! :)
customer_reviews.author: Tony S.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, portable, affordable
customer_reviews.text: A good little kit for quick jobs like hanging pictures, tightening towel rods, or simple installations. Inexpensive and reasonably well made. I bought two — one for each floor of my house. Now I don’t have to slog down to the garage to fix a small problem on the top floor of the house. Good for apartment dwellers too.
customer_reviews.author: ARussell

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for Newbies
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little intimidated by this toolkit. I know it's by no means a full toolkit, and undoubtedly someone much more handy out there is reading this review and thinking, "Really? Lulz", but it's true. Intimidating. That said, I've found it very useful as I've assembled the furniture for my room. I like the little box, though once the pieces come out they can be a pain to clip back into place. Still, nice to have everything in one place, even if it means I tuck the box away and cannot find it - hardly the fault of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ais

customer_reviews.title: The kind of simple toolset that’s useful in a bathroom or kitchen drawer.
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t your grandfather’s toolset in the garage, but it doesn’t bill itself that way. In fact, it’s the opposite. The kind of tool set you need in a kitchen or bathroom drawer so you can grab the right screwdriver bit to tighten a drawer handle or hammer in a small nail for a picture on the wall. Extremely handy.
customer_reviews.author: JaredPS

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Not a craftsman set but still worth having especially for its price and compactness. Some of e Pieces don’t always stay In Their compartments when opening and closing but tools have worked as needed and been used multiple times. Kit has Saved the day many times needing one of the tools it contains. They do the job.
customer_reviews.author: michele

customer_reviews.title: Pretty in Pink
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd time buying a pink tool kit. Despite getting pink for ME, my son took it off to school with him! This latest purchase was great but the edges of the case were a little rough. Other than that, it’s perfect. Tools are light but sturdy and hammer is appropriately weighted. Good value overall.
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my college student
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my daughter who is away at college and has her own apartment. She was a bit confused and didn't quite understand why we go her a tool set. I told her she will thank me later, which she did when she found out she needed a screwdriver to replace blinds.
customer_reviews.author: Collaboratories LLC

customer_reviews.title: Less sturdy than I expected
customer_reviews.text: From the picture it looks like sturdy working tools but they are more household tools. Not bad if it is a set primarily for small jobs around the house. The case is very compact and easy to store. I might get it for a housewarming present rather than for use in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: Penni Khandi

customer_reviews.title: Get a better set
customer_reviews.text: Very bad quality. The screw drivers and l wrenches are flat now, even though I used them a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Awesome company
customer_reviews.text: I think this item was a great value for the price. I only had one complaint. The tape measure broke after using a few times. The company was extremely helpful when I contacted them and they replaced the entire set even though I just wanted the tape measure replaced. I would buy from them again. So far all of the other tools have worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality
customer_reviews.text: The price is great for a 39-piece tool set, but the quality of the tools is extremely low. Not suitable for anything more than hanging a few pictures on the wall. If I knew the quality would be this low, I would have glady spent 3x as much on tools that actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Got for my husband for father's day and he hasn't opened it yet. It when the box arrived it's SOOO much smaller than the actual picture. It looks more the size of a case that holds nails and screws. I'm hoping the tools inside aren't miniature too :(...UPDATE:Was a miniature set. Hubs wasn't thrilled..
customer_reviews.author: deana s.

customer_reviews.title: Tool are cheap but they’ll get the job done (heavy chem smell)
customer_reviews.text: Tool kit comes with basic tools needed for work around the house. The only real complaints that I have with this kit include the cheap feeling it has with the plastics, the heavy chemical smell it has, and the handles that keep the tool box closed broke shortly after being opened. Other than that the tools will hold up for some time and should help you tackle household issues that may arise.
customer_reviews.author: Mendoza.C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for vacation condo
customer_reviews.text: Great tool set to leave in a vacation condo. When you don’t need a huge set of tools but do require basics....this set is perfect. I can hang pictures, tighten cabinet pulls, take screws out of walls, cut this picture hanging wire, just about anything basic you need, you can do with this set. And the convenient carrying case makes it super easy to store all in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Kellye Simmons

customer_reviews.title: It's Alright
customer_reviews.text: Some tools don't stay in their corresponding slots, so they do fall out when you open it. Like another review said, the side without the logo has tools that stay in their slots more, so I'd open it with the logo side down as well. The cutters seem a bit flimsy, but everything seems like it'd be fine to work with on small projects. The scissors are nice for cutting paracord, as I've tested myself. Nice enough product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Boone

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It does its job but it's cheaply made, which isn't surprising considering its low price. I'd rather spend a few extra dollars to get a better one. I can't imagine this lasting very long. I bought it for furniture building after my move, and it's serving its purpose, but it leaves a lot to be desired. The screws are already warping after I built my TV stand. The box cutter is a bit unstable and you can cut yourself if you're not careful. I guess I can't complain about the hammer or the measuring tape?
customer_reviews.author: Ara

customer_reviews.title: So far no complaints
customer_reviews.text: i mainly purchased this item to put togeather the things I purchase off amazon. So far I put togeather a t.v. Stand and a night stand. The tools done the job like it was meant to. I got a table and chairs coming and i'm gonna need to put them togeather. At least now I got the tools.
customer_reviews.author: don silvernail

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit for basics
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother when he bought his first home (condo). He isn't particularly handy but isn't helpless either, so this was a good in-between option that allows him to be able to take care of basic household fixes, hang some pictures, tighten loose cupboard hinges, assemble furniture, and that sort of thing. Great starter kit for anyone who may not have a quality tool collection yet but can't afford to wait for the basics.
customer_reviews.author: TheBug

customer_reviews.title: Good Gift & Basic Set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my friend who is getting a divorce and moved into a smaller apartment as a house warming gift. She loved it. It has everything basic that you would need for simple home repairs or use. It seems to be good quality for the price. It is a good small size for storing or taking with you
customer_reviews.author: Armywife83

customer_reviews.title: gift for 10 year old
customer_reviews.text: excellent tool kit- there was a utility knife in there that I removed before giving the tool kit to my son, but this is a great little kit he will probably have for a lifetime. I feel like I want to throw a lot of our old tools out and get a kit like this. LOL
customer_reviews.author: kjsalva

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Non-Handy People
customer_reviews.text: This kit is perfect for non-handy people like myself. It's important to have some tools in the house and this kit is exactly what I needed. It also came in handy as I just moved back into a newly renovated home and some workers coming in and out needed some tools so instead of going down to their cars, they used the tools from this kit!
customer_reviews.author: ariek1121

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: I honestly only bought this because I needed a hammer and a screwdriver to put together some furniture, and buying this kit was cheaper than buying the two separately, but I am pleasantly surprised! The hammer and screwdriver at least seem to be pretty good quality and help me put together several IKEA pieces.The blade in the kit, however, is really flimsy and broke/bent when I was trying to cut through cardboard, so I took away one star. Overall, this is a nice starter toolkit for a new home.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Always prepared
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to a girlfriend and her 'heading off to college' daughter. Too often, the household's tools seem to walk off and never get put back where they belong. Got tired of fussing with others, so just invested in my own tool kit and love it. Always prepared. Keep one in the car too. So, this kit is my go to gift for many occasions for other galpals. They always loved mine, so now they too are prepared for whatever.
customer_reviews.author: S. May

customer_reviews.title: MY NEW TOOLSET
customer_reviews.text: I love my new tool set; it has every thing but a couple of cresent wrenches...which I added. I have placed this behind the seat of my truck, and it is so handy to have tools wherever I go. I liked it so much, I bought a set for my wife to put in her car also.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Their pink
customer_reviews.text: I like that their girlie pink . I use them for odd jobs in the house. Their very sturdy and get the job done. For the price I bought one for my friend who didn’t have any tools and lives alone. She loves hers too! We used hers for measuring and cutting window film.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela W.

customer_reviews.title: scratched and scuffed
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift, and it arrived with all the parts. However, upon inspection I discovered that the box is scratched and scuffed. It’s honestly not worth my time to exchange but I would expect more from prime items.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Basic tool set for around the house
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a compact tool set with a decent variety of items so I can take care of small jobs myself. The set is well stocked without being too big. Some sets I looked at had things I have no idea what to do with and many small pieces that would just be overkill. These tools have decent weight and are compact in size. Some items do not fully click into the case or I would have given 5 stars. For my purposes, this is a great set.
customer_reviews.author: LQinRVA

customer_reviews.title: Great to have on hand!
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved and I instantly came online and grabbed this toolbox. I like that everything has a place within the toolbox. The only thing that didn't feel super high quality was the boxcutter, we used, as we should, to break down boxes, and the razor blade pretty easily popped out. Easy to close and bring with you. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Grignon

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our 10 year old son as his first real tool kit. Everything looks fine, will definitely be buying a new tool bag for the tools, the container they come in is a bit of a pain and nothing really stays where it’s supposed to when it’s closed.
customer_reviews.author: Penn Name

customer_reviews.title: needed new tools
customer_reviews.text: I just downsized from a house to an apartment, thought I'd get some tools and bought these. They are really nice, a lot of tools for the money. Sturdy and nice looking. They have already come in very handy in assembling things for the apartment. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Julie L. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, cheap, and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Tool set arrived today and I used the tape measure, pulled it out to measure for curtains and it will not recoil. Cheap, cheap, and cheap!
customer_reviews.author: LittleBit

customer_reviews.title: This cute pink tool set is great for basic needs around the house
customer_reviews.text: This cute pink tool set is great for basic needs around the house. For the price it is definitely worth it, as long as you're not looking to dive into any huge construction projects. Everything is real solid metal, so it's durable, but the handles are cheap and flimsy (especially on the screwdrivers).
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

product_meta.title: CARTMAN Orange 39-Piece Tool Set - General Household Hand Tool Kit with Plastic Toolbox Storage Case
feature_bullets: Contains the tools needed for most small repairs around the house
Heat treated and chrome plated to resist corrosion
Securely housed in a handy blow molded case
All tools meet or exceed ANSI critical standards
Contains the tools needed for most small repairs around the house

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars7,519 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
